@graph.rdfs:label: Coding experiments using GPT-3 on four social-science text classification tasks (Rytting et al.)
OpenAI GPT-3 (text-davinci family) used in few-shot prompted mode with 2–4 exemplars
Human coders (lightly trained for PP/NYT/Congress, intensively trained for TGP)
Bag-of-words Support Vector Classifier (SVC) trained on 3,000 labeled examples (used only on TGP)
Pigeonholing Partisans (PP) raw open-ended descriptions of partisans (7,675 texts from Rothschild et al. 2019 and related work)
PP dataset with human and GPT-3 codes on five dimensions (positivity, extremity, traits, issues, groups)
Congressional Hearing summaries (1946–2010) from Comparative Agendas Project
CAP-coded Congressional hearing summaries (n=326 re-coded texts) with codes from 3 humans + GPT-3
NYT headline CAP codes (n=560 sampled headlines) with codes from 4 humans + GPT-3 (headline-only)
The Guardian Populism survey open-ended responses on responsibility for political problems (≈20,000 responses, 4,000 human-coded)
TGP populism binary codes (presence/absence) from 2 intensively trained humans, GPT-3 (few-shot), and SVC (supervised baseline)
